{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient has received a high dose of radiation for squamous cell carcinoma. This radiation therapy can cause xerostomia, or dry mouth, which can make it difficult to make an impression. Polysulfide and polyether materials require a wet environment to set properly, so they may not be suitable for this patient. ZOE, or zinc oxide eugenol, can cause irritation and is generally not used for impressions. Irreversible hydrocolloids, on the other hand, are known for their ability to capture fine detail and are easy to use, even in a dry environment.", "answer_choice": "D. Irreversible hydrocolloids"}
